title: Raf & Ruby
description: At the top of their creative fields, the fashion designer Raf Simons and the artist Sterling Ruby have succeeded at something almost more elusive and unexpected: a true, collaborative brotherhood. In 2005, the Belgian fashion designer Raf Simons arranged a studio visit with the American artist Sterling Ruby, whose work he had begun to admire.

title: If You Destroy the Image, You'll Destroy the Thing Itself
description: If You Destroy the Image, You'll Destroy the Thing Itself (September 5th - October 2nd 2008) [Endre Aalrust, Ole Martin Lund Bo, Jan Freuchen, Sterling Ruby, Tatiana Trouve] on Amazon.com. *FREE* shipping on qualifying offers.

title: Sterling Ruby: Supermax 2008
description: Sterling Ruby: MOCA Focus [Philipp Kaiser, Lisa Mark, Sterling Ruby] on Amazon.com. *FREE* shipping on qualifying offers. Los Angeles-based artist Sterling Ruby, who was born in Germany in 1972, has created an expansive body of collage

title: Who is Sterling Ruby?
description: Grappling with the work of an artist who relishes multiple viewpoints, myriad materials and a slippery approach to meaning 'And he invents spaces, of which he is the convulsive possession.' Roger Caillois Landscape Annihilates Consciousness On screen: a blob of viscous matter is gathered on a palette, and then smeared against a blank field.

title: Stray Alchemists: Matt Bryans, Amy Granat, Lim Tzay Chuen, Takeshi Murata, Robin Rhode, Sterling Ruby
Sterling Ruby’s “Vampire”
description: Caught in that dark crawlspace between the living and the dead, hounded by a destructive, unending hunger and burdened with the need to indoctrinate: this is today's American empire as it appears in "Vampire," Sterling Ruby's exhibition of new and recent work at The Pace Gallery, Beijing.

title: Sterling Ruby in New York
description: In his latest show, Sterling Ruby - the Los Angeles-based artist best known for ceramic assemblages, effervescent collages, and installations that tweak minimalism's sacred forms - shifts his attention to pornography.

title: Raf Simons vs Sterling Ruby
description: Our visual landscape is constantly changing. An entire generation might be playing out their lives in the virtual world - but last night, Belgian designer Raf Simons and visual artist Sterling Ruby proved that Tumblr shrines have nothing on real life iconography.

title: Sterling Ruby
description: Sterling Ruby [Sterling Ruby] on Amazon.com. *FREE* shipping on qualifying offers. The multitude of media and techniques used by Sterling Ruby (born 1972) in his work--ranging from sculpture to collage

title: Sterling Ruby and Lucio Fontana
description: Andrea Rosen 525 West 24th Street, Chelsea Through Oct. 15 Pairing Sterling Ruby and Lucio Fontana is an inspired idea. Fontana (1899-1968) was the Italian avant-gardist known for cutting neat, graceful slices into his own monochrome paintings. He violated sheets of copper, too, leaving them bent, scratched and ragged along the edges of the incisions.

title: Sterling Ruby
description: STERLING RUBY João Ribas Flash Art n.271March - April 2010 SINCERELY HOSTILE : JOÃO RIBAS I'd like to begin by discussing this post-humanist condition underscoring so much of your practice - ranging as it does from sculpture to drawing, video, ceramics, and painting. published Sterling Ruby : Post-anxiety, post-cynicism, post-transgression, post-depression, post-war, post-law, post-gender, etc., etc., etc.

title: Young Artists: Sterling Ruby
description: Sterling Ruby's studio is huge: a compound of buildings, all painted flat black, on three quarters of an acre in Vernon, California, just southeast of downtown Los Angeles and directly beneath an LAX flight path.

title: Sterling Ruby: Balancing Act
description: The artist Sterling Ruby 's bright future appears momentarily in doubt as he turns left off 26th Street in an industrial sector of downtown Los Angeles and suddenly faces a tractor-trailer, its white cab aglitter with chrome and menace.

title: Best in Show | Sterling Ruby’s Caged Heat
description: G.R. Christmas/Courtesy PaceWildenstein, New York Best in Show follows the peregrinations of critic and novelist Linda Yablonsky, author of The Story of Junk, and a front-line chronicler of art-world events and exhibitions. Art is such a subjective pursuit that the next best thing to living with it may be having it to yourself in public.

title: Their Favorite Exhibitions of the Year
description: To take stock of the past year, Artforum contacted an international group of artists to find out which exhibitions and events were, in their eyes, the very best of 2010. SAÂDANE AFIF Jean-Pascal Flavien, No Drama House (Galerie Giti Nourbakhsch, Berlin) Constructed in the gallery's garden, Flavien's house starts with a series of unsolvable problems-no center, ...

title: Q. and A. | Sterling Ruby on Making It in L.A., His New Show in New York and the Power of the Art Market
description: Numerous New York galleries and museums synced their best shows to Frieze weekend, including Hauser & Wirth, which opened a much-anticipated new exhibition by the Los Angeles polymath Sterling Ruby at its newly renovated West 19th Street space last Friday.

title: A Hard Look at "Soft Work," Sterling Ruby's Cushy and Satirical Solo Exhibition in France
description: REIMS - "Soft Work," Sterling Ruby 's first solo show in France, opened last week at the Champagne-Ardenne FRAC in Reims. It focuses on several new pieces in an ensemble first conceived in 2005, and marks a departure for the artist, who previously worked primarily with more solid materials.
